> 1) JUnit seems to test "functions" that return a value. How will you 
> test "procedures" that do work instead?

You can assert the return value of a function but you can assert the 
state of your object.  I can assume that your "procedure" modifies some 
variables of the object, so simply assert these variables.

> 2) How will you test procedures that are composed of several 
> functions?

you have several solutions:
- test each method separately (from the most to the least specific)
- test only the top method (the least specific), and hope that all 
sub-methods are throughoutly tested

> 3) Can JUnit ever replace stepping thru with a debugger?

That's the goal.  But nobody can assure you that you won't use a 
debugger anymore (can be useful to isolate a bug).  These tools are 
complementary.

-Vladimir
